info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 12:22AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A BAND OF SNOW SHOWERS AND ISOLATED SNOW SQUALLS WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SCHOHARIE...RENSSELAER...MONTGOMERY...SOUTHERN SARATOGA...WESTERN RENSSELAER...SCHENECTADY...AND ALBANY COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band snow showers and isolated snow squalls accompanied by winds 30 to 35 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile briefly. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1217 AM EST, a snow squall was near Delanson, or 9 miles south of Amsterdam moving southeast at 35 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Delanson and Pattersonville-Rotterdam Junction around 1220 AM EST. Duanesburg and Rotterdam Junction around 1225 AM EST. Rotterdam and Altamont around 1235 AM EST. Schenectady and East Glenville around 1240 AM EST. Voorheesville around 1245 AM EST. Colonie and Guilderland around 1250 AM EST. Albany and Feura Bush around 1255 AM EST. Watervliet, Delmar, Latham and Loudonville around 100 AM EST. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 24 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 27. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 22 and 7. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. This band of snow showers and isolated squalls may produce a quick dusting to an inch in less than an hour. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
